comments: One of the best professors at UConn. Tells you exactly what to expect on tests, which are open note/book/laptop, so no useless busy work like memorization or studying the wrong material. Be careful though, time limits can be tough and 90% of your grade is exams, which average around an 80%. Go to class and do the work and you\'ll be more than set.
Her exams are open note and open book, but they can be tricky if you don\'t prepare. She has good lectures and makes it interesting. She also goes over many problems in class that are helpful.
Knows the subject well, available after class, and expresses interest in the subject and the students. Homeworks posted online, labs are fun.
Kind of tough in class, nice person, keep up with the notes and don\'t fall behind. Very approachable outside of class, the lab is a huge part of the grade that you must stay on top of.
